required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Conduct of Anaesthesia During Acute Ischaemia Stroke: a Retrospective Case Series of Patients Undergoing Mechanical Thrombectomy

brief_summary.textblock:
Title: Conduct of anaesthesia during acute ischaemic stroke: a retrospective case series of patients undergoing mechanical thrombectomy.
Design: This study will be a retrospective consecutive observational case series

detailed_description.textblock: The Aim of this study is to describe the baseline characteristics, procedural and post-operative clinical characteristics of anaesthetic care delivered to consecutive adult patients who underwent mechanical thrombectomy as part of their routine clinical care between 01/01/2016 and 01/10/2020 at Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust (sample size approximately 250).

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluating the number of patients requiring mechanical thrombectomy
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months
primary_outcome.description: This retrospective study will identify the anaesthetic care delivered to a group of patients undergoing mechanical thrombectomy for the management of acute ischaemic stroke. The data collected will be from all patients that received this treatment between 01/01/2016 and 01/10/2020 at Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust. This data written up and of interest both to our organisation and to comparable neuroscience centres in the UK and internationally. Outcomes that will be measured in this clinical case study are highlighted below.

secondary_outcome.measure: Background information: Age (>/= 18 years of age)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Background information: Gender (male or female)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Background information: The degree of disability/dependence after a stroke will be measured using the presenting modified Rankin Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months
secondary_outcome.description: 0 - No symptoms. - No significant disability. Able to carry out all usual activities, despite some symptoms. - Slight disability. Able to look after own affairs without assistance, but unable to carry out all previous activities. - Moderate disability. Requires some help, but able to walk unassisted. - Moderately severe disability. Unable to attend to own bodily needs without assistance, and unable to walk unassisted. - Severe disability. Requires constant nursing care and attention, bedridden, incontinent. - Dead.

secondary_outcome.measure: Background information: Presenting blood pressure (systolic and diastolic)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Background information: Presenting heart rate (beats per minute)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Background information: The fitness of the patient will be measured using the American Society of Anaesthetists Classification
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months
secondary_outcome.description: ASA I A normal healthy patient Healthy ASA II A patient with mild systemic disease ASA III A patient with severe systemic disease ASA IV A patient with severe systemic disease that is a constant threat to life ASA V A moribund patient who is not expected to survive without the operation ASA VI A declared brain-dead patient whose organs are being removed for donor purposes

secondary_outcome.measure: Background information: Height of the patient (m)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Background information: Weight of the patient (kg)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Background information: Measuring the distance from referring hospital (miles)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months
secondary_outcome.description: Hospitals included: Kings Mill Hospital, Royal Derby Hospital, Leicester, Lincoln, Boston, Burton

secondary_outcome.measure: The patient's stroke classification will be measured using National Institute for Health Stroke Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months
secondary_outcome.description: 1-4 Minor stroke 5-15 Moderate stroke 16-20 Moderate to severe stroke 21-42 Severe stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: Mode of anaesthesia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months
secondary_outcome.description: Awake / Sedated / Converted on-table to General Anaesthetic / GA.

secondary_outcome.measure: To identify the anaesthetic agents used
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: The level of the anaesthetist (registrar / consultant)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Intra - procedural observations: Measuring time spent with systolic blood pressure (mmHg) <10% of presenting BP (minutes)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Intra - procedural observations: Quantifying any episodes of hypoxia (SpO2 <94%)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Intra-procedural interventions: Identifying if the patient required vasopressors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Measuring the response of treatment using the post-procedural Thrombolysis in Cerebral Infarction scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months
secondary_outcome.description: Grade 0: no perfusion Grade 1: penetration with minimal perfusion Grade 2: partial perfusion Grade 2A: only partial filling (less than two-thirds) of the entire vascular territory is visualised Grade 2B: complete filling of all of the expected vascular territory is visualised but the filling is slower than normal Grade 3: complete perfusion

secondary_outcome.measure: To identify the level of care required immediately post procedure (Level 0,1,2,3)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Identify the duration of Intensive Care stays (days)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Identify the duration of stay in hospital (days)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: To measure the long term outcome: National Institute for Health Stroke Scale at 24 hours post-procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months
secondary_outcome.description: 1-4 Minor stroke 5-15 Moderate stroke 16-20 Moderate to severe stroke 21-42 Severe stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: To measure the long term outcome: Modified Rankin Score at 90 days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months
secondary_outcome.description: 0 - No symptoms. - No significant disability. Able to carry out all usual activities, despite some symptoms. - Slight disability. Able to look after own affairs without assistance, but unable to carry out all previous activities. - Moderate disability. Requires some help, but able to walk unassisted. - Moderately severe disability. Unable to attend to own bodily needs without assistance, and unable to walk unassisted. - Severe disability. Requires constant nursing care and attention, bedridden, incontinent. - Dead.

secondary_outcome.measure: To measure the long term outcome: Mortality at 90 days (survived / deceased)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

secondary_outcome.measure: To measure the long term outcome: Discharge destination (home / institution)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 9 months

study_pop.textblock: Participants will be identified by existing clinical records of mechanical thrombectomy procedures undertaken at Nottingham University Hospitals and already collated as part of routine service evaluation and clinical care. Sampling will be consecutive. The sampling window (01/01/2016-01/10/2020) has been chosen because mechanical thrombectomy is a new therapy that was not undertaken in current form before 2016.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age â‰¥ 18 years old
- Undergone mechanical thrombectomy for the management of acute ischaemia stroke between 01/01/2016-01/10/2020 at Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust.
Exclusion Criteria:
- No pre-specified exclusion criteria.

link.description: Raising the Standards: RCoA quality improvement compendium, 4th Edition September 2020: 12.7 Endovascular thrombectomy
